marketNews.title: Government Releases 4Q25 Economic Stimulus Package Valued at IDR 16.2 Trillion
marketNews.content:
The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated on Monday (15/9) that the government will issue an economic stimulus package worth approximately 16.2 trillion Rupiah in 4Q25. This is the third stimulus in 2025, following the first stimulus (~33 trillion Rupiah) in January-February 2025 and the second stimulus (~24.4 trillion Rupiah) in June-July 2025.

The latest stimulus package consists of 8 programs that will generally apply for the remainder of 2025, namely: 1) university graduate internship programs; 2) expansion of government-borne PPh 21 (DTP) for tourism sector workers; 3) food aid; 4) job accident and death insurance contribution assistance for non-wage earners such as online motorcycle taxi partners; 5) BPJS Ketenagakerjaan additional service benefit programs for housing; 6) cash for work programs; 7) acceleration of the deregulation of Government Regulation No. 28; and 8) urban pilot projects in large cities to improve settlement quality and provision of space for the gig economy.

Several programs noted by us include:
- Food Aid (7 trillion Rupiah) - Allocated for 18.3 million beneficiary families (KPM) in the form of 10 kilograms of rice per month for October and November, with an option for extension until December 2025 if budget realization is not optimal. This aid comes shortly after reports of premium rice scarcity and rising rice prices.
- Cash for Work (5.7 trillion Rupiah) - Allocated for 609,465 beneficiaries in the form of daily wages for projects under the Ministry of Transportation (1.8 trillion Rupiah) and the Ministry of Public Works (3.5 trillion Rupiah) for the September-December 2025 period. Previously, a similar program was implemented in 2018.
- PPh 21 DTP Incentive for Tourism Sector (120 billion Rupiah) - Allocated for 552,000 workers in the tourism, hotel, restaurant, and cafe (Horeca) sectors. Previously, in the first stimulus, the government only provided PPh 21 incentives for workers in labor-intensive sectors.

Besides programs for the remainder of 2025, Airlangga also announced that the government will continue 4 incentive programs next year. These incentives include: 1) 0.5% final income tax for MSME individual taxpayers, extended until 2029; 2) PPh 21 DTP for tourism sector workers with salaries up to 10 million per month; 3) PPh 21 DTP for labor-intensive sector workers with salaries up to 10 million per month; and 4) discounts on job accident and death insurance contributions for non-wage earners such as online motorcycle taxi partners.

Regarding the 0.5% final income tax incentive for MSMEs, previously the government only extended this policy for 1 year, which is for 2025, for MSME actors who have fully utilized this incentive (7 years).

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: We assess that this latest stimulus package complements the liquidity injection policy announced by the Minister of Finance last week to boost economic growth. In addition to the stimulus disbursement, the acceleration of general government spending and the impact of the BI interest rate cut need to be monitored by investors to look for signs of economic recovery, which could become a positive catalyst for reversing the foreign outflow trend.

marketNews.title: Other hot topics you need to know...
marketNews.content:
Deputy Chairman of Commission XI of the House of Representatives from the PKB Faction, Hanif Dhakiri, asked the government not to increase the Tobacco Product Excise Duty (CHT) and suggested the government take innovative steps to meet the rising excise tax deposit target in 2026, one of which is by eradicating illegal cigarettes. Responding to this request, Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, confirmed that he will review the cigarette excise policy further because as of now there is no decision on whether the cigarette excise rate will rise, remain the same, or decrease. Purbaya also stated that the government is calculating the potential additional state revenue from eradicating illegal excise duties, which will form the basis for future cigarette excise policies.

Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, opened up the opportunity for the transfer of more than 10% of the shares in PT Freeport Indonesia (PTFI) from Freeport-McMoran to the government. Bahlil explained that this target is the result of the latest negotiations, after previously only a 10% increase was agreed upon. This statement was supported by the CEO of BPI Danantara, Rosan Roeslani, who conveyed that the government plans to increase its shareholding in PTFI by 12%. This plan is targeted to be completed soon, awaiting the approval of President Prabowo Subianto. The government is also striving for the share transfer to occur at a low price, considering the thinning valuation of PTFI's assets. This increase in government shares is a condition for the extension of PTFI's IUPK, which is scheduled to expire in 2041. Currently, the share ownership composition of PTFI consists of the Indonesian government through MIND ID (51%) and Freeport-McMoran (49%).

Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated that the Housing KUR worth 130 trillion Rupiah will be launched through Himbara banks this year. Of this amount, 117 trillion Rupiah will be focused on supporting MSME developers with a ceiling of up to 20 billion Rupiah, while the remaining 13 trillion Rupiah will be allocated to the demand side covering house renovations. The government will provide an interest subsidy of 5% for MSME developers with a maximum tenor of 4 years for working capital loans and a maximum of 5 years for investment loans. Airlangga also added that the Housing KUR program is confirmed to have a budget allocation until 2026.

Non-Independent Commissioner of Nusa Raya Cipta (NRCA), Johannes Suriadjaja, sold 2 million NRCA shares at an average price of approximately 1,070 Rupiah per share on September 10, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.1 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, Johannes Suriadjaja's direct ownership portion in NRCA decreased from 0.08% to none.

tickerNews.title: ASII Increases Ownership in HEAL to Approximately 20%
tickerNews.content: HEAL: Hermina Medikaloka shareholder, Astra International (ASII), purchased approximately 1.47 billion HEAL shares at an average price of 1,831 Rupiah per share on September 9-12, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.7 trillion Rupiah and was conducted through its subsidiary, PT Astra Healthcare Indonesia. Following this transaction, Astra's direct and indirect ownership in HEAL increased from approximately 10.42% to approximately 20%. Meanwhile, a number of shareholders who also sit on the board of directors or commissioners—namely Binsar Parasian Simorangkir, Meijani Wibowo, Husen Sutakaria, and Yulisar Khiat—sold a total of 481.9 million HEAL shares at a price of 1,850 Rupiah per share on September 12 for the purpose of strategic partnership restructuring.

tickerNews.title: Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) clarifies consolidation plans are in initial exploration stages
tickerNews.content: GIAA: Garuda Indonesia in a clarification to the IDX stated that the plan for consolidating state-owned aviation sector companies is currently still in the initial exploration stage, with ongoing coordination with relevant stakeholders. Currently, the company is focusing on performance recovery through equity improvement, optimization of strategic actions such as fleet restoration, business ecosystem recovery, and increasing passenger traffic. Previously, the President Director of Pertamina, Simon Aloysius Mantiri, stated on Thursday (11/9) that his party had discussions with Garuda Indonesia to merge the Pelita Air airline with Garuda.

tickerNews.title: EXCL Directors Increase Shareholdings
tickerNews.content: EXCL: Two directors of XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera, David Arcelus Oses and Yessie Dianty Yosetya, purchased approximately 2.08 million shares and approximately 728 thousand shares of EXCL, respectively, at an average price of approximately 2,600 Rupiah per share on September 10-12, 2025. The total transaction value for both reached approximately 7.3 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, David Arcelus Oses's direct ownership in EXCL increased from 0.0089% to 0.0203%, while Yessie Dianty Yosetya's ownership increased from none to 0.004%.

tickerNews.title: NICL Controller Increases Direct Ownership Stake
tickerNews.content: NICL: The controller of PAM Mineral, Christopher Sumasto Tjia, purchased approximately 13.7 million NICL shares at an average price of 1,042 Rupiah per share on September 15, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 14.2 billion Rupiah. Following this transaction, Christopher Sumasto Tjia's direct ownership portion in NICL increased from 0.482% to 0.61%.

tickerNews.title: KOKA Announces Majority Stake Acquisition by Ningbo Lixing Enterprise Management Co., Ltd.
tickerNews.content: KOKA: Koka Indonesia announced that Ningbo Lixing Enterprise Management Co., Ltd. plans to purchase 63.5% of KOKA shares with an undisclosed transaction value. After the acquisition is complete, Ningbo Lixing will become the new controlling shareholder of KOKA, obligating them to conduct a Mandatory Tender Offer (MTO). This acquisition aims to enhance business development prospects in the construction sector, particularly infrastructure construction.
